Introduction

This lab has several goals:

  • To write a simple class.
  • To expose you to the style of documentation used for classes in the Java library.
  • To encourage experimenting with programming in Java.
  • To help you interpret Java's runtime error messages.
  • To illustrate how classes interact and the importance of conforming to a specification.

Before you write any code, create a new project named project2 in your Eclipse workspace. Within it, create a package lab2. Consult the previous lab for a reminder on how to do this.

Then, go ahead and download the sample code and put it in your lab2 package.

  • Basketball.java
  • BasketballTest.java
  • RabbitModel.java
  • TestModel.java
How do I get the Basketball code into my project?
You can do this in many different ways; here is one strategy:
  • Right click on the link above and select "Save Link As...".
  • Download the file to a temporary location such as your Downloads folder.
  • Find the src folder for your project in the Eclipse Package Explorer, and in it find the lab2 package.
  • Open up File Explorer or Finder, and drag the file into the lab2 package.
Alternatively, click on the link above to view the Basketball.java code. Create a new, empty class called Basketball in your lab2 package as we did in last week's lab, and copy and paste the Basketball code from the browser into the Eclipse editor window.
